message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is about domain adaptation of neural machine translation, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes an unsupervised adaptation method using lexicon induction, which involves machine learning techniques, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) likely sub-categories as well. Additionally, the paper uses BLEU scores to evaluate the performance of the proposed method, which is a common metric in NLP research. This makes cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper mentions the use of back-translation, which is a technique commonly used in computer vision research. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is also a possible sub-category, although less likely than the others.
